description: Note that GNOME Character Map has been replaced by GNOME Characters.
Many hours have I spent venturing the perilous depths of Unicode using this tool. I still prefer it to the stripped down GNOME Characters.
I don't understand why gnome-characters was the default install on Debian.
All I can say was that I couldn't find em-dash with gnome-characters, but found it easily with gucharmap. Gucharmap has better filters, too.
summary: prefer the older gucharmap over gnome-characters

description: This is somewhat useful, in spite of other reviews. It can be used to drag-and-drop unusual characters into text documents or to type out words with the on-screen buttons for copy-paste. However it's not as useful as it could be. A "click to insert" feature would be nice. But it saves you from having to remember unicode or esoteric keyboard combinations if you only need special characters ȍĉċäšĭōƞáŀŀŷ. That said, it would be nice it if it included trademark and copyright symbols and other letter-like characters.

If it were just a tool for exploring the characters available under Unicode, it'd get a much better rating, because it does that fairly well. I could imagine it doing a better job of that, but I can't really articulate how. It's certainly better at showing the available characters than GNOME Characters.

But the Fedora 'Software' application says it helps you insert those characters. It would probably be a useful feature to have, but it just does not do that, unless your keymap allows you to type in unicode hex codes and you know how to use that. Typing in hex codes may work, but it's really clunky.
summary: It's supposed to let you insert various characters, but it doesn't

description: Exactly as advertised on the tin: Allows you to search emoji and copy them for pasting into another app. Simple. Support for the gnome search bar is particularly handy. My one gripe is that the copy/paste workflow is a little involved: To copy an emoji you need to (i) click the emoji, (ii) click copy in the newly opened detail window, (iii) close the detail window. It would be nice if there were a more streamlined approach (e.g., clicking copied the emoji without the detail window entering into the workflow. For example, a clipboard copy icon somewhere on the character image would be helpful.
summary: Search emoji & symbols visually, find the one you want, and copy it

description:
Coming from the Windows world, where this is a system feature, I was becoming MAD looking for it.
Thank you, dveloper/s!
Despite being a very useful program to find unusual characters the lack of a search function makes it unecessarily hard to find an specific character.

summary: soy de colombia GRACIAS señor linux

description: Que bueno que hayan pensado en esto. Muchas gracias.
it is really an essential tool that I have on all my desktop systems to use characters that I don't have on my keyboard
L'application de référence pour insérer des caractères en environnement Gnome.
Je recommande, je ne peux pas m'en passer pour insérer des caractèrers que je ne peux pas saisir au clavier.
Для людей, работающих со шрифтами и UNICODE это -- необходимое приложение.
